findings.title: BT - Burns Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to burn tokens from a specific address by calling the `distributeReward` function, resulting in winner contract addresses losing corresponding tokens.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens by calling the `distributeReward` function, which mints tokens equal to 1 million percent of the `totalSupply`, potentially leading to highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract mints tokens by calling the `distributeReward` function and swaps them. The swap amount is way higher than the `totalSupply`. It is important to note that the price of the token representing it, can be highly volatile.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of your Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: It is important to be aware of the order of operations when performing arithmetic calculations. This is especially important when working with large numbers, as the order of operations can affect the final result of the calculation. Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.
